title: Veer Announces: New Jukebox Typefaces for May 2004
content:
**Veer Announces: New Jukebox Typefaces for May 2004**   
   
Veer is pleased to announce the addition of two new typefaces to our very own [Jukebox](http://web.archive.org/web/20130916195837/http:/www.veer.com/jukebox/) collection. These typefaces can be found in the May edition of the [Veer Visual Elements Catalog](http://web.archive.org/web/20130916195837/http:/www.veer.com/ideas/catalogs/) and on our web site.   
   
............................................................................................................................................   
   
 ![Jukebox Stephanie Marie](http://web.archive.org/web/20130916195837im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/35646.gif)   
   
 [Stephanie Marie](http://web.archive.org/web/20130916195837/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?Image=JBT0000067) by Jason Walcott **{ Jukebox }** They say lower loops in handwriting indicate sensuality. No wonder new Stephanie Marie is so attractive. A lively, brush-style script font, named after a dear friend of the designer. Contains several alternate characters and ligatures. One weight.   
   
............................................................................................................................................   
   
 ![Jukebox Fanfare](http://web.archive.org/web/20130916195837im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/35647.gif)   
   
 [Fanfare](http://web.archive.org/web/20130916195837/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?Image=JBT0000066) by Jason Walcott **{ Jukebox }** Drum roll please... Fanfare marches out with jubilant style. A happy, shiny headline typeface reminiscent of game show and situation comedy titles from the late 60s and early 70s. One weight.   
   
............................................................................................................................................   
   
For more information regarding these new type products, contact:   
   
Jacqueline Wallace   
403 313 4942

author: Grant Hutchinson
